title: Obasanjo Meets Buhari In Aso Rock, Tells Journalists, ‘Comot Joo’
content:
Former president, Olusegun Obasanjo, on Tuesday evening, made a surprise visit to the Presidential Villa, Abuja where he met with President Muhammadu Buhari. 
 
The two leaders met behind closed-doors for about one hour at the President’s office. 
 
Details of the meeting were unavailable as at the time of filing this report, and no official statement was issued by the presidency. 
 
Emerging from the parley, accompanied by his host, Obasanjo declined to speak to journalists, saying, ‘comot joo.’ 
 
In response to the questions on his mission to the Villa, the former president merely told the journalists in pidgin English: comot joor (give way). 
 
Buhari had on August 21 named Obasanjo his Special Envoy to mediate and help find a solution to the crisis brewing in Guinea Bissau. 
 
It is believed he may have come to brief the president on the latest developments in the politically embattled country.
